name: Jonas Lim Hong Xiang
headline: Digital scholar focused on building practical software, clear communication, and measurable outcomes.

bullets: Translated business requirements into technical features through direct customer engagement.
Architected AWS backend in Python and Terraform, and designed 40+ PostgreSQL schemas with 30+ RESTful APIs.
Designed and deployed full-stack infrastructure using Python (backend), Flutter (frontend), and AWS with Terraform.
Led a team of engineers across technical planning and code reviews.
Worked on ML projects spanning predictive pricing, vehicle damage detection, and engine acoustics.
Built scalable and fault-tolerant ML systems and microservices on GPU clusters, serving >= 12,000 requests/day.
Evaluated and replaced a production Mask R-CNN model with YOLOv5, reducing inference time from 500ms to 50ms.
Built data preparation pipelines, feature store, and metadata store which improved training data quality by 50%.
Collaborated with cross-functional stakeholders across Singapore, Malaysia, Indonesia, and Taiwan to increase ML service user adoption by 40%.
Optimized AWS network architectures, databases, and model training servers, saving US$120k in 2023.
Replaced a monolithic web crawler with a distributed system that reduced processing time from 7 days to 9 hours.
Reimagined the team's ML infrastructure and work processes, saving 75 man-hours/month per person.
Designed data engineering frameworks and mentored the team on automating data pipelines and best coding practices.
Refined project repository structures and optimized system designs for production systems.
Built a defect classification model that saved inspection tool capacity by 10%.
Optimized SQL queries in model data preparation pipelines, reducing query time by 50%.
Built a predictive model for product yield and deployed it to on-premises servers, achieving US$11M savings.
Developed end-to-end ML solutions from problem formulation and model development to productionalization.
